Review Date: 2020/09/22
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['John Francis Daley', 'Jonathan Goldstein'], 'Producers': ['John Davis', 'Jason Bateman', 'John Fox', 'James Garavente'], 'Starring': ['Jason Bateman', 'Rachel McAdams', 'Billy Magnussen']}
Review Text: Being a gamer, I’m OBSESSED with Game Night. Max and Annie’s witty and loving nerdy relationship, Gary’s odd demeanor, Brooks’s cocky attitude, Sarah’s partnership with Ryan’s goofy, air headed yet intelligent self, Kevin’s comedically-charged curiosity with Michelle’s mystery celebrity hookup, and everything in between! Whenever anyone asks for my recommendation for a comedy, I direct them to this movie and they always come back to me telling me how funny it was and how they full on bought it! I can’t recommend this gem enough!!!
Review Title: BEST. MOVIE. EVER. PERIOD.
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Heaven's Lost Property - The Angeloid of Clockwork (Blu-ray/DVD Combo)
Brittany Karbowski  (Actor),     Greg Ayres  (Actor),     Christopher Bevins  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Anime
['Product Description', 'BR/DVD.', 'Amazon.com', 'Although the', "Heaven's Lost Property", 'feature', 'The Angeloid of Clockwork', "(2011) was released theatrically, it plays like a choppy series of OVA adventures cut together. Pretty high school student Hiyori Kazane nurtures a crush on Tomoki. She watches him with his friend Sohara and the Angeloids, but she's too shy to say anything to him. The first half of the movie echoes the original series: Tomoki and his friends go about their usual misadventures around town and at local festivals. The filmmakers include plenty of jiggle shots and underwear jokes. At one point, the girls' panties fly away like a swarm of butterflies, although the viewer never learns why. The last third of the film turns serious: apparently Hiyori is dreaming her everyday adventures while her body lies in the facility known as Synapse. When she's hit by a truck, Hiyori dies in her dream and reenters her real body. She wants to come back to Sorami so intensely, she returns as an Angeloid--to destroy Tomoki. The tragic romance plays oddly against the gross jokes. During much of the film, Tomoki is drawn as a sort of toy-avatar who argues with himself on the toilet and rides the conveyor belt in a sushi bar, naked on a plastic tray. Although", "Heaven's Lost Property", 'has proved popular on both sides of the Pacific,', 'otaku', "who watch it for the fan service shots probably won't enjoy the ill-starred romance, and romantics will be put off by the raw jokes. (Rated TV MA: risqué humor, toilet humor, nudity, cartoon violence, violence against women)", '--Charles Solomon']
{'Genre': 'Anime & Manga', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Blu-ray, Color, Widescreen, Animated', 'Contributor': 'Brittany Karbowski, Jamie Marchi, Christopher Bevins, Eric Vale, Greg Ayres', 'Language': 'Japanese, English', 'Number Of Discs': '2', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.77:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.47 Ounces', 'Item model number': '704400058837', 'Director': 'Christopher Bevins', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Blu-ray, Color, Widescreen, Animated', 'Run time': '1 hour and 35 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 26, 2013', 'Actors': 'Brittany Karbowski, Greg Ayres, Eric Vale, Jamie Marchi', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Funimation Prod', 'Number of discs': '2'}
This is probably the most funny and cutest anime me and my hubs have ever seen. It's packed with pervy stuff, cuteness, and humor. This anime will strike the heartstrings and make your sides hurt from laughing too hard. It's perfectly scripted and made- it's just too much perfection in one show. Daisuki!
Sora no Otoshimono/Heaven's Lost Property...
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Aneesh Chaganty'], 'Producers': ['Timur Bekmambetov', 'Sev Ohanian', 'Natalie Qasabian', 'Adam Sidman'], 'Starring': ['John Cho', 'Debra Messing', 'Joseph Lee'], 'Studio': ['Screen Gems']}
The second I saw the trailer for this in theaters, I was beyond excited to see it. I was not disappointed at all and can’t wait to watch it again. It’s one of those movies where you’ll be playing detective in your head and think you have the right answer only to become stumped the next minute and second guess yourself. I highly recommend giving this a watch, you won’t regret it!
Keeps you curious!

{'Audio languages': ['English (US) [Audio Description]', 'English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Gary Dauberman'], 'Producers': ['Richard Brener', 'Michael Clear', 'Michelle Morrissey', 'Dave Neustadter', 'Victoria Palmeri', 'Peter Safran', 'Judson Scott', 'James Wan'], 'Starring': ['Vera Farmiga', 'Patrick Wilson', 'Mckenna Grace']}

Not awful, not great...
{'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ari Aster'], 'Producers': ['Patrik Andersson', 'Thomas Benski', 'Tyler Campellone', 'Scott E. Chester', 'Beau Ferris', 'Fredrik Heinig', 'Lars Knudsen', 'Pelle Nilsson', 'Jeffrey Penman'], 'Starring': ['Florence Pugh', 'Jack Reynor', 'William Jackson Harper'], 'Studio': ['A24 Distribution LLC']}
I love this movie because it has every element a true horror film should have. Unsettling atmosphere, brow-shifting moments, creepy scenes that make you thankful for not having to experience them yourself, disturbing characters that make your skin crawl- you name it. I’m a horror fan and honestly I don’t do well with watching this alone, even in daylight. I highly recommend Midsommar to anyone who loves being weirded/freaked out or enjoys thought-provoking subjects. By the way, this is a movie that you need to actually watch from start to finish (as well as pay attention to the small details).. so set aside time, put down the phone, and prepare yourself for this bizarre ride!
Incredibly dark and thrilling!

{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jon Watts'], 'Producers': ['Kevin Feige', 'Amy Pascal'], 'Starring': ['Tom Holland', 'Jake Gyllenhaal', 'Michael Keaton']}
It was a great movie, but I will say NOTHING compares to Andrew Garfield’s Spiderman.
Funny and enjoyable!
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Anthony Russo', 'Joe Russo'], 'Producers': ['Kevin Feige'], 'Starring': ['Robert Downey Jr.', 'Chris Evans', 'Mark Ruffalo'], 'Studio': ['Marvel']}
I despise long movies (I get bored easily), but this is possibly the ONLY one I can watch over and over and over again and NEVER get tired or bored of. My boyfriend got me into the Marvel universe (I was always into X-men but he introduced me to these movies when we met) and I was amazed at how fast I fell in love with each and every single Marvel movie (except for Tom Holland’s Spiderman films because Andrew Garfield is KING). Endgame is perfect and beyond captivating. I’m sure it’s still be amazing for people who aren’t hardcore Marvel fans who skipped over Iron Man or Hulk or Thor or Avengers, but TRUST me when I say if you’re one of those people then you’re missing out on an incredible and thrilling journey. I can’t recommend this movie enough!!!
Brilliant, intense, hilarious, and action-packed!
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dennie Gordon'], 'Producers': ['Denise Di Novi', 'Robert Thorne', 'Mary-Kate Olsen', 'Ashley Olsen'], 'Starring': ['Mary-Kate Olsen', 'Ashley Olsen', 'Andy Richter'], 'Studio': ['Warner Bros.']}
This is not a movie that anyone should take seriously or have high expectations for. It’s about two polar opposite twins who unwillingly get stuck together after many mishaps, learning about each other along the way and what it means to be sisters. The cast is awesome but there are some scenes that might cause some light cringing. Overall, it’s a funny story with some heavy moments and I truly enjoy putting this movie on from time to time when I need to chill and laugh. Did I mention Simple Plan is in it???
Awkward acting, Simple Plan, and lots of humor!

Max and Annie’s witty and loving nerdy relationship, Gary’s odd demeanor, Brooks’s cocky attitude, Sarah’s partnership with Ryan’s goofy, air headed yet intelligent self, Kevin’s comedically-charged curiosity with Michelle’s mystery celebrity hookup, and everything in between! Whenever anyone asks for my recommendation for a comedy, I direct them to this movie and they always come back to me telling me how funny it was and how they full on bought it! I can’t recommend this gem enough!!!
BEST. MOVIE. EVER. PERIOD.
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Genre Preference:** The user enjoys a dynamic blend of humor, romance, and fanservice while maintaining a strong appreciation for suspenseful thrillers and horror films featuring unsettling atmospheres and complex narratives. Their recent interactions continue to reflect an enthusiasm for comedies with clever dialogue and character dynamics.

- **Content Style:** They favor comedic narratives that present quirky characters and relationships, increasingly drawn to films that balance action, emotional engagement, and humor. Their sophisticated taste for intricate plots supports their discerning critical thinking, particularly in relationship-driven stories.

- **Quality Appreciation:** The user values well-crafted storytelling and high production quality, evident in their latest review that showcases their love for comedies with depth and relatable character arcs. They appreciate films that evoke laughter and emotional connection.

- **Experience Seeking:** They seek emotional experiences that blend comedy with intensity, delighting in narratives that explore psychological complexities while maintaining a humorous edge.

- **Social Viewing:** Thriving on shared experiences, they particularly enjoy films that spark laughter and romance, while also relishing discussions about more suspenseful thrillers and thought-provoking horror and action films.

- **Product Format:** The user prefers high-quality media formats, such as Blu-ray, to optimize their viewing experiences across all genres.

Overall, the user remains engaged with content that harmonizes comedy, romance, action, and horror, emphasizing intricate narratives and production quality while continuing to seek lighthearted and engaging thematic explorations.
